member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.AuthenticationResult
member.summary: Contains the results of one token acquisition operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.AuthenticationResult.AccessToken
member.summary: Gets the Access Token requested.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.AuthenticationResult.UniqueId
member.summary: Gets the Unique Id of the user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.AuthenticationResult.ExpiresOn
member.summary: Gets the point in time in which the Access Token returned in the Token property ceases to be valid. This value is calculated based on current UTC time measured locally and the value expiresIn received from the service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.AuthenticationResult.TenantId
member.summary: Gets an identifier for the tenant the token was acquired from. This property will be null if tenant information is not returned by the service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.AuthenticationResult.User
member.summary: Gets the user object. Some elements in User might be null if not returned by the service. It can be passed back in some API overloads to identify which user should be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.AuthenticationResult.IdToken
member.summary: Gets the entire Id Token if returned by the service or null if no Id Token is returned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.AuthenticationResult.Scopes
member.summary: Gets the scope values returned from the service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.AuthenticationResult.CreateAuthorizationHeader
member.summary: Creates authorization header from authentication result.
member.returns: Created authorization header

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.ClientApplicationBase
member.Summary: Abstract class containing common API methods and properties. Both PublicClientApplication and ConfidentialClientApplication extend this class.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.ClientApplicationBase.DefaultAuthority
member.Summary: Default Authority used for interactive calls.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.ClientApplicationBase.Component
member.summary: Identifier of the component consuming MSAL and it is intended for libraries/SDKs that consume MSAL. This will allow for disambiguation between MSAL usage by the app vs MSAL usage by component libraries.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.ClientApplicationBase.Authority
member.Summary: Authority provided by the developer or default authority used by the library.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.ClientApplicationBase.ClientId
member.summary: Will be a default value. Can be overridden by the developer. Once set, application will bind to the client Id.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.ClientApplicationBase.RedirectUri
member.summary: Redirect Uri configured in the app registration portal. PublicClientApplication has a default value of urn:ietf:wg:oauth:2.0:oob.This default does not apply to iOS and Android as the library needs to leverage system webview for authentication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.ClientApplicationBase.SliceParameters
member.summary: Sets or Gets the custom query parameters that may be sent to the STS for dogfood testing. This parameter should not be set by the developers as it may have adverse effect on the application.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.ClientApplicationBase.UserTokenCache
member.Summary: Token Cache instance for storing User tokens.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.ClientApplicationBase.ValidateAuthority
member.summary: Gets/sets a value indicating whether authority validation is ON or OFF. Value is true by default. It should be set to false by the deveopers for B2C applications.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.ClientApplicationBase.Users
member.summary: Returns a User centric view over the cache that provides a list of all the available users in the cache for the application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.ClientApplicationBase.GetUser(System.String)
member.summary: Get user by identifier from users available in the cache.
member.param: user identifier

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.ClientApplicationBase.AcquireTokenSilentAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},Microsoft.Identity.Client.IUser)
member.summary: Attempts to acquire the access token from cache. Access token is considered a match if it AT LEAST contains all the requested scopes. This means that an access token with more scopes than requested could be returned as well. If access token is expired or close to expiration (within 5 minute window), then refresh token (if available) is used to acquire a new access token by making a network call.
member.param: Array of scopes requested for resource
User for which the token is requested.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.ClientApplicationBase.AcquireTokenSilentAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},Microsoft.Identity.Client.IUser,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Attempts to acquire the access token from cache. Access token is considered a match if it AT LEAST contains all the requested scopes. This means that an access token with more scopes than requested could be returned as well. If access token is expired or close to expiration (within 5 minute window), then refresh token (if available) is used to acquire a new access token by making a network call.
member.param: Array of scopes requested for resource
User for which the token is requested
Specific authority for which the token is requested. Passing a different value than configured does not change the configured value
If TRUE, API will ignore the access token in the cache and attempt to acquire new access token using the refresh token if available

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.ClientApplicationBase.Remove(Microsoft.Identity.Client.IUser)
member.summary: Removes all cached tokens for the specified user.
member.param: instance of the user that needs to be removed

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IClientApplicationBase
member.summary: Component containing common validation methods

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IClientApplicationBase.Component
member.summary: Identifier of the component consuming MSAL and it is intended for libraries/SDKs that consume MSAL. This will allow for disambiguation between MSAL usage by the app vs MSAL usage by component libraries.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IClientApplicationBase.Authority
member.Summary: Authority provided by the developer or default authority used by the library.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IClientApplicationBase.ClientId
member.summary: Will be a default value. Can be overridden by the developer. Once set, application will bind to the client Id.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IClientApplicationBase.RedirectUri
member.summary: Redirect Uri configured in the portal. Will have a default value. Not required if the developer is using the default client Id.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IClientApplicationBase.ValidateAuthority
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether address validation is ON or OFF.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IClientApplicationBase.Users
member.summary: Returns a user-centric view over the cache that provides a list of all the available users in the cache.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IClientApplicationBase.SliceParameters
member.summary: Sets or Gets the custom query parameters that may be sent to the STS for dogfood testing. This parameter should not be set by the developers as it may have adverse effect on the application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IClientApplicationBase.GetUser(System.String)
member.summary: Get user by identifier from users available in the cache.
member.param: user identifier

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IClientApplicationBase.AcquireTokenSilentAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},Microsoft.Identity.Client.IUser)
member.summary: Attempts to acquire the access token from cache. Access token is considered a match if it AT LEAST contains all the requested scopes. This means that an access token with more scopes than requested could be returned as well. If access token is expired or close to expiration (within 5 minute window), then refresh token (if available) is used to acquire a new access token by making a network call.
member.param: Array of scopes requested for resource
User for which the token is requested.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IClientApplicationBase.AcquireTokenSilentAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},Microsoft.Identity.Client.IUser,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Attempts to acquire the access token from cache. Access token is considered a match if it AT LEAST contains all the requested scopes. This means that an access token with more scopes than requested could be returned as well. If access token is expired or close to expiration (within 5 minute window), then refresh token (if available) is used to acquire a new access token by making a network call.
member.param: Array of scopes requested for resource
User for which the token is requested
Specific authority for which the token is requested. Passing a different value than configured does not change the configured value
If TRUE, API will ignore the access token in the cache and attempt to acquire new access token using the refresh token if available

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IClientApplicationBase.Remove(Microsoft.Identity.Client.IUser)
member.summary: Removes all cached tokens for the specified user.
member.param: instance of the user that needs to be removed

member.summary: Gets the AccessToken Type.

member.summary: MSAL Flavor: .NET or WinRT

member.summary: MSAL assembly version

member.summary: CPU platform with x86, x64 or ARM as value

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Internal.MsalIdHelper
member.summary: This class adds additional query parameters or headers to the requests sent to STS. This can help us in collecting statistics and potentially on diagnostics.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IPublicClientApplication
member.summary: Component to be used for native applications (Desktop/UWP/iOS/Android).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IPublicClientApplication.AcquireTokenAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Interactive request to acquire token.
member.param: Array of scopes requested for resource
member.returns: Authentication result containing token of the user

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IPublicClientApplication.AcquireTokenAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Interactive request to acquire token.
member.param: Array of scopes requested for resource
Identifier of the user. Generally a UPN.
member.returns: Authentication result containing token of the user

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IPublicClientApplication.AcquireTokenAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},Microsoft.Identity.Client.IUser)
member.summary: Interactive request to acquire token.
member.param: Array of scopes requested for resource
User object to enforce the same user to be authenticated in the web UI.
member.returns: Authentication result containing token of the user

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IPublicClientApplication.AcquireTokenAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String,Microsoft.Identity.Client.UIBehavior,System.String)
member.summary: Interactive request to acquire token.
member.param: Array of scopes requested for resource
Identifier of the user. Generally a UPN.
Enumeration to control UI behavior.
This parameter will be appended as is to the query string in the HTTP authentication request to the authority. The parameter can be null.
member.returns: Authentication result containing token of the user

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IPublicClientApplication.AcquireTokenAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},Microsoft.Identity.Client.IUser,Microsoft.Identity.Client.UIBehavior,System.String)
member.summary: Interactive request to acquire token.
member.param: Array of scopes requested for resource
User object to enforce the same user to be authenticated in the web UI.
Enumeration to control UI behavior.
This parameter will be appended as is to the query string in the HTTP authentication request to the authority. The parameter can be null.
member.returns: Authentication result containing token of the user

member.summary: Interactive request to acquire token.
member.param: Array of scopes requested for resource
Identifier of the user. Generally a UPN.
Enumeration to control UI behavior.
This parameter will be appended as is to the query string in the HTTP authentication request to the authority. The parameter can be null.
Array of scopes for which a developer can request consent upfront.
Specific authority for which the token is requested. Passing a different value than configured does not change the configured value
member.returns: Authentication result containing token of the user

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IUser
member.summary: Contains information of a single user. This information is used for token cache lookup and enforcing the user session on STS authorize endpont.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IUser.DisplayableId
member.summary: Gets a displayable value in UserPrincipalName (UPN) format. The value can be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IUser.Name
member.summary: Gets given name of the user if provided by the service. If not, the value is null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IUser.IdentityProvider
member.summary: Gets identity provider if returned by the service. If not, the value is null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IUser.Identifier
member.summary: Gets an identifier for the user that is used by the library and the service as a strong handle to user identity. Cannot be null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.LogCallback
member.summary: Callback delegate that allows the developer to consume logs handle them in a custom manner.
member.param: Log level of the message
Pre-formatted log message
Indicates if the log message contains PII. If Logger.PiiLoggingEnabled is set to false then this value is always false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger
member.summary: MSAL Logger class that allows developers to configure log level, configure callbacks etc.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger.LogLevel
member.summary: MSAL Log Levels

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger.LogLevel.Error
member.summary: Error Log level

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger.LogLevel.Warning
member.summary: Warning Log level

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger.LogLevel.Info
member.summary: Information Log level

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger.LogLevel.Verbose
member.summary: Verbose Log level

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger.LogCallback
member.summary: Callback instance that can be provided by the developer to consume and publish logs in a custom manner. The property can only be set once and it will throw an ArgumentException if called twice.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger.Level
member.summary: Configurable log level. Default value is Info.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger.PiiLoggingEnabled
member.summary: Flag to enable/disable logging of PII data. PII logs are never written to default outputs like Console, Logcat or NSLog. Default is set to false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger.DefaultLoggingEnabled
member.summary: Flag to enable/disable logging to platform defaults. In Desktop/UWP, Event Tracing is used. In iOS, NSLog is used. In android, logcat is used.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger.Error(System.String)
member.summary: Method for error logging

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger.ErrorPii(System.String)
member.summary: Method for error logging of Pii

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger.Warning(System.String)
member.summary: Method for warning logging

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger.WarningPii(System.String)
member.summary: Method for warning logging of Pii

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger.Info(System.String)
member.summary: Method for information logging

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger.InfoPii(System.String)
member.summary: Method for information logging for Pii

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger.Verbose(System.String)
member.summary: Method for verbose logging

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger.VerbosePii(System.String)
member.summary: Method for verbose logging for Pii

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger.Error(System.Exception)
member.summary: Method for error exception logging

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.Logger.ErrorPii(System.Exception)
member.summary: Method for error exception logging for Pii

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalClientException
member.summary: This exception class represents errors that are local to the library or the device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalClientException.MultipleTokensMatchedError
member.summary: MultipleTokensMatched were matched.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalClientException.NonHttpsRedirectNotSupported
member.summary: Non HTTPS redirects are not supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalClientException.NetworkNotAvailableError
member.summary: The request could not be preformed because the network is down.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalClientException.DuplicateQueryParameterError
member.summary: Duplicate query parameter in extraQueryParameters

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalClientException.AuthenticationUiFailedError
member.summary: The request could not be preformed because of a failure in the UI flow.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalClientException.AuthenticationCanceledError
member.summary: Authentication canceled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalClientException.JsonParseError
member.summary: JSON parsing failed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalClientException.InvalidJwtError
member.summary: JWT was invalid

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalClientException.StateMismatchError
member.summary: State returned from the STS was different than the one sent.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalClientException.TenantDiscoveryFailedError
member.summary: Tenant discovery failed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalClientException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code.
member.param: The error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalClientException.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code and error message.
member.param: The error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalClientException.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code, error message and inner exception.
member.param: The error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalException
member.summary: The exception type thrown when an error occurs during token acquisition.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalException.UnknownError
member.summary: Unknown Error occured.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code.
member.param: The error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalException.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code and error message.
member.param: The error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalException.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference if no inner exception is specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalException.ErrorCode
member.summary: Gets the protocol error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalException.ToString
member.summary: Creates and returns a string representation of the current exception.
member.returns: A string representation of the current exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalServiceException
member.summary: The exception type thrown when service returns and error response or other networking errors occur.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalServiceException.ServiceNotAvailable
member.summary: Service is unavailable and returned HTTP error code within the range of 500-599.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalServiceException.RequestTimeout
member.summary: Http Request timed out.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalServiceException.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code, error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The protocol error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalServiceException.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code, error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The protocol error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
Status code of the resposne received from the service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalServiceException.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code, error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The protocol error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference if no inner exception is specified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalServiceException.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code, error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The protocol error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
Status code of the resposne received from the service.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference if no inner exception is specified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalServiceException.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code, error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The protocol error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The status code of the request.
The claims challenge returned back from the service.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference if no inner exception is specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalServiceException.StatusCode
member.summary: Gets the status code returned from http layer. This status code is either the HttpStatusCode in the inner HttpRequestException response or NavigateError Event Status Code in browser based flow (See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb268233(v=vs.85).aspx). You can use this code for purposes such as implementing retry logic or error investigation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalServiceException.ResponseBody
member.summary: Raw response body received from the server.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalServiceException.ToString
member.summary: Creates and returns a string representation of the current exception.
member.returns: A string representation of the current exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalUiRequiredException
member.summary: This exception class is to inform developers that UI interaction is required for authentication to succeed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalUiRequiredException.InvalidGrantError
member.summary: Standard OAuth2 protocol error code. It indicates to the libray that the user needs to go the UI for getting a new token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalUiRequiredException.NoTokensFoundError
member.summary: No tokens were found matching the criteria.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalUiRequiredException.UserNullError
member.summary: This error code comes back from AcquireTokenSilent calls when null user is passed into AcquireTokenSilent calls.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalUiRequiredException.TokenCacheNullError
member.summary: This error code comes back from AcquireTokenSilent calls when null token cache reference is passed into the application constructor

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalUiRequiredException.NoPromptFailedError
member.summary: One of two conditions was encountered. 1. The PromptBehavior.Never flag was passed and but the constraint could not be honored because user interaction was required. 2. An error occurred during a silent web authentication that prevented the authentication flow from completing in a short enough time frame.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalUiRequiredException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code.
member.param: The error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalUiRequiredException.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code and error message.
member.param: The error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.MsalUiRequiredException.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code, error message and inner exception indicating the root cause.
member.param: The error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
Represents the root cause of the exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.TokenCache
member.summary: Token cache class used by ConfidentialClientApplication and PublicClientApplication to store access and refresh tokens.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.TokenCache.TokenCacheNotification
member.summary: Notification for certain token cache interactions during token acquisition.
member.param: Arguments related to the cache item impacted

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.TokenCache.BeforeAccess
member.summary: Notification method called before any library method accesses the cache.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.TokenCache.BeforeWrite
member.summary: Notification method called before any library method writes to the cache. This notification can be used to reload the cache state from a row in database and lock that row. That database row can then be unlocked in AfterAccess notification.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.TokenCache.AfterAccess
member.summary: Notification method called after any library method accesses the cache.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.TokenCache.HasStateChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag indicating whether cache state has changed. MSAL methods set this flag after any change. Caller application should reset the flag after serializing and persisting the state of the cache.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.TokenCache.SaveAccesTokenCacheItem(Microsoft.Identity.Client.Internal.Cache.AccessTokenCacheItem)
member.summary: Only used by dev test apps

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.TokenCache.SaveRefreshTokenCacheItem(Microsoft.Identity.Client.Internal.Cache.RefreshTokenCacheItem)
member.summary: Only used by dev test apps

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.TokenCacheNotificationArgs
member.summary: Contains parameters used by the MSAL call accessing the cache.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.TokenCacheNotificationArgs.TokenCache
member.summary: Gets the TokenCache

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.TokenCacheNotificationArgs.ClientId
member.summary: Gets the ClientId.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.TokenCacheNotificationArgs.User
member.summary: Gets the user object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.UIBehavior
member.summary: Indicates how AcquireToken should prompt the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.UIBehavior.SelectAccount
member.summary: AcquireToken will send prompt=select_account to authorize endpoint and would show a list of users from which one can be selected for authentication.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.UIBehavior.ForceLogin
member.summary: The user will be prompted for credentials by the service. It is achieved by sending prompt=login to the service.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.UIBehavior.Consent
member.summary: The user will be prompted to consent even if consent was granted before. It is achieved by sending prompt=consent to the service.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.UIBehavior.Never
member.summary: Only available on .NET platform. AcquireToken will send prompt=attempt_none to authorize endpoint and the library uses a hidden webview to authenticate the user.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.UIBehavior.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Equals method override to compare UIBehavior structs
member.param: object to compare against
member.returns: true if object are equal.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.UIBehavior.GetHashCode
member.summary: Override to compute hashcode
member.returns: hash code of the PromptValue

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.UIBehavior.op_Equality(Microsoft.Identity.Client.UIBehavior,Microsoft.Identity.Client.UIBehavior)
member.summary: operator overload to equality check
member.param: first value
second value
member.returns: true if the object are equal

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.UIBehavior.op_Inequality(Microsoft.Identity.Client.UIBehavior,Microsoft.Identity.Client.UIBehavior)
member.summary: operator overload to equality check
member.param: first value
second value
member.returns: true if the object are not equal

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.User
member.summary: Contains information of a single user. This information is used for token cache lookup and enforcing the user session on STS authorize endpont.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.User.DisplayableId
member.summary: Gets a displayable value in UserPrincipalName (UPN) format. The value can be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.User.Name
member.summary: Gets given name of the user if provided by the service. If not, the value is null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.User.IdentityProvider
member.summary: Gets identity provider if returned by the service. If not, the value is null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.UserAssertion
member.summary: Credential type containing an assertion representing user credential.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.UserAssertion.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor to create the object with an assertion. This constructor can be used for On Behalf Of flow which assumes the assertion is a JWT token. For other flows, the other construction with assertionType must be used.
member.param: Assertion representing the user.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.UserAssertion.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor to create credential with assertion and assertionType
member.param: Assertion representing the user.
Type of the assertion representing the user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.UserAssertion.Assertion
member.summary: Gets the assertion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.UserAssertion.AssertionType
member.summary: Gets the assertion type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.SilentWebUI.NavigationWaitMiliSecs
member.summary: This is how long we allow between completed navigations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.SilentWebUI.NavigationOverallTimeout
member.summary: This is how long all redirect navigations are allowed to run for before a graceful termination of the entire browser based authentication process is attempted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.SilentWebUI.WaitForCompletionOrTimeout(System.Threading.Thread)
member.summary: Waits on the UI Thread to complete normally for NavigationOverallTimeout. After it attempts shutdown the UI thread graceful followed by aborting the thread if a graceful shutdown is not successful.
member.returns: Returns true if the UI thread completed on its own before the timeout. Otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.SilentWebUI.OnAuthenticate
member.summary: Callers expect the call to show the authentication dialog to be synchronous. This is easy in the interactive case as ShowDialog is a synchronous call. However, ShowDialog will always show the dialog. It can not be hidden. So it can not be used in the silent case. Instead we need to do the equivalent of creating our own modal dialog. We start a new thread, launch an invisible window on that thread. The original calling thread blocks until the secondary UI thread completes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.SilentWindowsFormsAuthenticationDialog.SuppressBrowserSubDialogs
member.summary: Make sure that the browser control does not surface any of it's own dialogs. For instance bad certificate or javascript error dialogs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.SilentWindowsFormsAuthenticationDialog.SignalDone(System.Exception)
member.summary: This method must only be called from the UI thread. Since this is the callers opportunity to call dispose on this object. Calling Dispose must be done on the same thread on which this object was constructed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Client.StaTaskScheduler
member.summary: Provides a scheduler that uses STA threads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.StaTaskScheduler._threads
member.summary: The STA threads used by the scheduler.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Client.StaTaskScheduler._tasks
member.summary: Stores the queued tasks to be executed by our pool of STA threads.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.StaTaskScheduler.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the StaTaskScheduler class with the specified concurrency level.
member.param: The number of threads that should be created and used by this scheduler.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Client.StaTaskScheduler.MaximumConcurrencyLevel
member.summary: Gets the maximum concurrency level supported by this scheduler.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.StaTaskScheduler.Dispose
member.summary: Cleans up the scheduler by indicating that no more tasks will be queued. This method blocks until all threads successfully shutdown.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.StaTaskScheduler.QueueTask(System.Threading.Tasks.Task)
member.summary: Queues a Task to be executed by this scheduler.
member.param: The task to be executed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.StaTaskScheduler.GetScheduledTasks
member.summary: Provides a list of the scheduled tasks for the debugger to consume.
member.returns: An enumerable of all tasks currently scheduled.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.StaTaskScheduler.TryExecuteTaskInline(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether a Task may be inlined.
member.param: The task to be executed.
Whether the task was previously queued.
member.returns: true if the task was successfully inlined; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Acquires token from the service for the confidential client. This method attempts to look up valid access token in the cache.
member.param: Array of scopes requested for resource

Array of scopes requested for resource
member.returns: Authentication result containing token of the user for the requested scopes

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IConfidentialClientApplication.AcquireTokenForClientAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Acquires token from the service for the confidential client. This method attempts to look up valid access token in the cache.
member.param: Array of scopes requested for resource
member.returns: Authentication result containing application token for the requested scopes

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IConfidentialClientApplication.AcquireTokenForClientAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Acquires token from the service for the confidential client. This method attempts to look up valid access token in the cache.
member.param: Array of scopes requested for resource
If TRUE, API will ignore the access token in the cache and attempt to acquire new access token using client credentials
member.returns: Authentication result containing application token for the requested scopes

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IConfidentialClientApplication.GetAuthorizationRequestUrlAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets URL of the authorize endpoint including the query parameters.
member.param: Array of scopes requested for resource
Identifier of the user. Generally a UPN.
This parameter will be appended as is to the query string in the HTTP authentication request to the authority. The parameter can be null.
member.returns: URL of the authorize endpoint including the query parameters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Client.IConfidentialClientApplication.GetAuthorizationRequestUrlAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Gets URL of the authorize endpoint including the query parameters.
member.param: Array of scopes requested for resource
Address to return to upon receiving a response from the authority.
Identifier of the user. Generally a UPN.
This parameter will be appended as is to the query string in the HTTP authentication request to the authority. The parameter can be null.
Array of scopes for which a developer can request consent upfront.
Specific authority for which the token is requested. Passing a different value than configured does not change the configured value
member.returns: URL of the authorize endpoint including the query parameters.
